formalText: I had spoken with the physician Dr. White and had read his reports and know some of the things about why she is  here today.
She is 28 years old and feels like an old lady.
She has a 5 and 7 year old daughter
Talked about the potential that she has PTSD and maybe should take the
test called the ACE study adverse childhood experiences study
There is a therapy that we will start called prolonged exposure therapy, which is just looking at the memories in a safe environment and trying to retrain Pathways in her brain.
We plan to also look at some medications for anxiety and depression.
We're going to have some lab work done before we look at medications and we will be in treatment.
She states that she hasn't been sleeping well, and  has the same nightmare over and over.
She was wondering if she could get something to help her sleep and forget past events.
She wants my  help because she feels like she can't live her life.
She does not want to be around groups of people. She is so anxious and irritable, and the feelings have increased more in the last few months.
She states, "sometimes I feel stuck and need to talk to my counselor if that makes sense".
She feels that she has less patience with her daughters and she also feels that she spaces out more and is having a hard time concentrating and sticking with tasks.
She has also been mildly more sad than usual.
She feels like she wants to be alone.
She has been having the same nightmares.
She worries about her daughters being harmed.
She has had nightmares for years throughout her childhood.
And now she is 28 and still having them and never like sleep and try to avoid it. She need only about 5 hours a night.
She has noticed her nausea and loss of appetite since the separation from her husband and since moving into her grandparents house again.
She has had a panic attack and doesn't feel entirely safe in the grandparents house.
She was also worried about how the separation with her husband will affect the girls.
Her parents divorcing was devastating to her
She has had times of great fear and panic attacks when she split from her husband and moved back into her house
I used to have to play with her cousin in the basement of the grandparents house.
He was not a nice person, five years older than her and liked to teach her all sorts of things sexual things.
She was only five at the time and didn't understand.
She felt dirty and ashamed I didn't tell anyone until I was an adult.
She has gone to counseling for this as an adult.
Her mom was a yeller and cursed a lot and was not a happy person.
Her husband was also a yeller and controller he meant to protect her, but it goes too far.
In the past, no medications and just basically talks about things that have happened in the past for councelors.
She has had a suicide plan in the past
when she was a teenager, and would take a bunch of pills or just get into my mom's car and turn it on and go to sleep in the close-up garage.
Her Mom married an alcoholic that beat her and then she beat us the cops were at our house a lot to break up the fighting.
They didn't eat well or often and she usually cooked for her sister and brother because my mom and stepdad were at the bar.
She was in school sometimes across the street or sometimes across town.
She got behind in school because of changing so many times and she learned to not get too close to friends.
She smoked cigarettes at a pack a day and this started when she quit alcohol
She went through treatment for her drinking and have been sober for eight years.
No drug used otherwise.
She does not want to be around groups of people.
Her family does not know about this abuse from her cousin.
She told the counselor once that she can't tell them because it would  cause pain for the family.
In terms of family history and any mental illness or other medical issues,
her mom was depressed and has other issues. Her father is fine
She grew up with her step dad abusing her mom.
Her mom was pretty physical because she would get beaten. She has a 5 and 7 year old daughter
She feels irritable and have been having trouble trouble concentrating and remembering things.
She doesn't have an appetite and feels nauseated a lot lately.
She has not had feelings of suicide because of her daughters age but once they grow up
